dcterms:description: The heat equation describes diffusion over a surface, solved on the 2D plane and the 2-sphere, where it proves challenging for non-equivariant methods.
dcterms:title: Heat equation on R²

dcterms:description: The heat equation describes diffusion over a surface, solved on the 2D plane and the 2-sphere, where it proves challenging for non-equivariant methods.
dcterms:title: Heat equation on S²

dcterms:creator: George Gabriel Stokes
dcterms:description: Navier-Stokes equations for an incompressible fluid with dynamics defined on a 2-Torus, solved using Gaussian random fields as initial conditions.
dcterms:title: Navier-Stokes on T²

dcterms:creator: Joseph Galewsky
Richard K Scott
Lorenzo M Polvani
dcterms:description: Global shallow-water equations model large-scale oceanic and atmospheric flow on the globe, derived from Navier-Stokes under shallow fluid depth assumptions.
dcterms:title: Shallow-water on S²

dcterms:description: Boussinesq equation for internally heated convection in a ball, relevant for modeling Earth's mantle convection with varying internal temperature.
dcterms:title: Internally-heated convection in a 3D ball
